meanings.sent1: He rewelds the broken metal piece to fix it properly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic rewelds the exhaust pipe to stop the leak.
meanings.sent3: The artist rewelds the sculpture, giving it a new life.
meanings.sent4: She rewelds the bond between them, making it stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: Rewelds the connection carefully to ensure it holds.

meanings.definition: Rewelds (noun): plural form of reweld, meaning a second welding of something
meanings.sent1: The rewelds on the metal joint were clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: He collected all the rewelds from the workshop for inspection.
meanings.sent3: The box was full of rewelds, waiting to be used in the project.
meanings.sent4: The rewelds on the gate showed the craftsmanship of the welder.
meanings.sent5: Each of the rewelds added strength to the structure.
